data.name: AssemblyDirectlyUnderLibWarning
data.value: The assembly '{0}' is placed directly under 'lib' folder. It is recommended that assemblies be placed inside a framework-specific folder. Move it into a framework-specific folder.

data.name: AssemblyOutsideLibWarning
data.value: The assembly '{0}' is not inside the 'lib' folder and hence it won't be added as a reference when the package is installed into a project. Move it into the 'lib' folder if it needs to be referenced.

data.name: BuildConventionIsViolatedWarning
data.value: - At least one {0} file was found in '{1}', but '{2}' was not.
data.comment: 0 - file extension (either .props or .targets) 1 - directory that the file falls under 2 - correct file path

data.name: DefaultSpecValueWarning
data.value: The value "{0}" for {1} is a sample value and should be removed. Replace it with an appropriate value or remove it and rebuild your package.

data.name: DependenciesGroupsForEachTFMBeginningToFiles
data.value: - Add lib or ref assemblies for the

data.name: DependenciesGroupsForEachTFMBeginningToNuspec
data.value: - Add a dependency group for

data.name: DependenciesGroupsForEachTFMEndingToFile
data.value: target framework

data.name: DependenciesGroupsForEachTFMEndingToNuspec
data.value: to the nuspec

data.name: DependenciesGroupsForEachTFMHasCompatMatch
data.value: Some target frameworks declared in the dependencies group of the nuspec and the lib/ref folder have compatible matches, but not exact matches in the other location. Unless intentional, consult the list of actions below:

data.name: DependenciesGroupsForEachTFMHasNoExactMatch
data.value: Some target frameworks declared in the dependencies group of the nuspec and the lib/ref folder do not have exact matches in the other location. Consult the list of actions below:

data.name: FilePathTooLongWarning
data.value: The file '{0}' path, name, or both are too long. Your package might not work without long file path support. Please shorten the file path or file name.

data.name: IconUrlDeprecationWarning
data.value: The 'PackageIconUrl'/'iconUrl' element is deprecated. Consider using the 'PackageIcon'/'icon' element instead. Learn more at https://aka.ms/deprecateIconUrl

data.name: InvalidFrameworkWarning
data.value: The folder '{0}' under 'lib' is not recognized as a valid framework name or a supported culture identifier. Rename it to a valid framework name or culture identifier.

data.name: InvalidPlaceholderFileWarning
data.value: The file at '{0}' uses the symbol for empty directory '_._', but it is present in a directory that contains other files. Please remove this file from directories that contain other files.

data.name: InvalidPrereleaseDependencyWarning
data.value: A stable release of a package should not have a prerelease dependency. Either modify the version spec of dependency "{0}" or update the version field in the nuspec.

data.name: InvalidUndottedFrameworkInDependencyGroupsWarning
data.value: The following dependency group(s) require(s) dots in the framework version: {0}

data.name: InvalidUndottedFrameworkInFilesWarning
data.value: The following packaged file folder(s) require(s) dots in the framework version: {0}

data.name: InvalidUndottedFrameworkInFrameworkAssemblyGroupsWarning
data.value: The following framework assembly group(s) require(s) dots in the framework version: {0}

data.name: InvalidUndottedFrameworkInReferenceGroupsWarning
data.value: The following reference group(s) require(s) dots in the framework version: {0}

data.name: InvalidUndottedFrameworkWarning
data.value: One or more target framework specifiers in your package are missing required dots in their framework version numbers. This is required as of .NET5.0. Please rename them to include dots as needed (e.g. 'net50' to 'net5.0').

data.name: LegacyVersionWarning
data.value: The package version '{0}' uses SemVer 2.0.0 or components of SemVer 1.0.0 that are not supported on legacy clients. Change the package version to a SemVer 1.0.0 string. If the version contains a release label it must start with a letter. This message can be ignored if the package is not intended for older clients.

data.name: LicenseUrlDeprecationWarning
data.value: The 'licenseUrl' element will be deprecated. Consider using the 'license' element instead.
data.comment: Please don't localize the items in the ''. license and licenseUrl

data.name: Migrator_AssemblyDirectlyUnderLibWarning
data.value: The assembly 'lib\{0}' will be ignored when the package is installed after the migration.

data.name: Migrator_PackageHasContentFolder
data.value: 'content' assets will not be available when the package is installed after the migration.

data.name: Migrator_PackageHasInstallScript
data.value: install.ps1 script will be ignored when the package is installed after the migration.

data.name: Migrator_XdtTransformInPackage
data.value: XDT transform file '{0}' will not be applied when the package is installed after the migration.

data.name: MisplacedInitScriptWarning
data.value: The file '{0}' will be ignored by NuGet because it is not directly under 'tools' folder. Place the file directly under 'tools' folder.

data.name: MisplacedTransformFileWarning
data.value: The transform file '{0}' is outside the 'content' folder and hence will not be transformed during installation of this package. Move it into the 'content' folder.

data.name: MissingReadmeInformation
data.value: The created package is missing a readme. Go to aka.ms/nuget/authoring-best-practices#readme to learn why package readmes are important.

data.name: NoRefOrLibFolderInPackage
data.value: This package does not contain a lib/ or ref/ folder, and will therefore be treated as compatible for all frameworks. Since framework specific files were found under the build/ directory for {0}, consider creating the following empty files to correctly narrow the compatibility of the package: {1}

data.name: PlaceholderFileInPackageWarning
data.value: An empty folder placeholder file '{0}' is in a non-empty folder and should be removed.

data.name: ReferencesInNuspecAndRefFilesDontMatchWarning
data.value: References were found in the nuspec, but some reference assemblies were not found in both the nuspec and ref folder. Add the following reference assemblies:

data.name: ReferencesInNuspecAndRefFilesDontMatchWarningAddToNuspecListItemFormat
data.value: - Add {0} to the {1} reference group in the nuspec

data.name: ReferencesInNuspecAndRefFilesDontMatchWarningAddToNuspecNoTfmListItemFormat
data.value: - Add {0} to the references element in the nuspec

data.name: ReferencesInNuspecAndRefFilesDontMatchWarningAddToRefListItemFormat
data.value: - Add {0} to the ref/{1}/ directory

data.name: ScriptOutsideToolsWarning
data.value: The script file '{0}' is outside the 'tools' folder and hence will not be executed during installation of this package. Move it into the 'tools' folder.

data.name: UnrecognizedLicenseIdentifier
data.value: The license identifier '{0}' is not recognized by the current toolset.

data.name: UnrecognizedScriptWarning
data.value: The script file '{0}' is not recognized by NuGet and hence will not be executed during installation of this package. Rename it to install.ps1, uninstall.ps1 or init.ps1 and place it directly under 'tools'.

data.name: UnspecifiedDependencyVersionWarning
data.value: The version of dependency '{0}' is not specified. Specify the version of dependency and rebuild your package.

data.name: WinRTObsoleteWarning
data.value: The file at '{0}' uses the obsolete 'WinRT' as the framework folder. Replace 'WinRT' or 'WinRT45' with 'NetCore45'.
